postcards.text:
One thing nurses across primary health care have in common is...
passion for looking after people in the community.

The next step in my nursing journey is... 
to complete my post graduate degree in rural and remote health, specialising in primary health care, to deliver the best possible care!

I feel valued as a nurse when...
patients call & want to speak with me.

I feel valued as a nurse when...
I see or hear about a patient who has changed (positive change) due to an intervention I did. LOVE IT!

I feel valued as a nurse when...
patients and families express their thanks for the care our practice provides as a whole team.

I feel valued as a nurse when...
my opinion is valued and respected.

I feel valued as a nurse when...
my patients tell me how much I've helped them and thank me for my work as a nurse - often through Education and translating medical jargon into something they can understand.

1.answerText: I'm learning to use critical thinking to analyse evidence in clinical practice.
1.name: Accountability and responsibility
1.definition: Works within scope of practice, while exercising judgment about actions and accepting professional accountability and responsibility

1.answerText: As part of the interdisciplinary primary health care team, I'm learning how to determine the health needs of individuals.
1.name: Assessment and Management
1.definition: Applies evidence-based clinical skills in nursing assessment and management to meet the needs of individuals accessing care

actionsToGrow.text: Review the care provided to a specific "at risk" patient cohort in your area to ensure care delivery is aligned with current clinical guidelines
Access to care
Coordinate and manage a Nurse clinic in your area of practice
Incorporate evidence-based tools into your care delivery

1.answerText: I lead by example with regards to adopting a culturally safe approach to delivering primary health care for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to support and encourage attendance.
1.name: Culturally safe practice
1.definition: Practices culturally safe care for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people accessing care

1.answerText: I confidently take an active role in providing culturally safe care for culturally and linguistically diverse people.
1.name: Culturally safe practice (2)
1.definition: Practice culturally safe care for all culturally and linguistically diverse people accessing care

1.answerText: I confidently utilise tools to monitor the delivery and quality of my care to the individual accessing care and seek support when required.
1.name: Evaluation of care
1.definition: Applies evidence-based clinical skills to evaluate the delivery of primary health care nursing to assess the impact on individuals accessing care

actionsToGrow.text: LIsten to a presentation describing consumer satisfaction
Apply validated tools when implementing and evaluating care delivery
Lead a patient evaluation initiative
Support your team to apply validated tools

1.answerText: I'm learning to recognise the importance of health literacy as a part of culturally safe care.
1.name: Health literacy
1.definition: Applies a health literacy approach to improve the individual's engagement in their health and communication between the individual and primary health care team

actionsToGrow.text: Review and improve health literacy
Review your organisationâ€™s policy on health literacy
Ensure members of your health care team are aware of culturally appropriate organisations
Teach other members of your health care team

1.answerText: I have the confidence to participate in performance appraisals of myself and others to improve clinical practice.
1.name: Personal Reflection
1.definition: Demonstrates ability to undertake personal reflection of clinical practice

1.answerText: I'm learning to develop and apply person-centred care plans with clear objectives.
1.name: Planning care
1.definition: Applies evidence-based clinical skills in planning nursing care to meet the needs of individuals accessing care

actionsToGrow.text: Review the care provided to a specific "at risk" patient cohort in your area to ensure care delivery is aligned with current clinical guidelines
Consider post graduate qualifications
Seek opportunities to disseminate outcomes of population health approaches within the primary health care sector
Access resources

1.answerText: I'm confident to be a part of relevant public health strategies and work collaboratively to improve health needs and avoid hospitalisation.
1.name: Population Health
1.definition: Alignment of competence and clinical skills with population health needs to deliver targeted public health, health promotion and prevention to address the needs of the community

actionsToGrow.text: Population Health for Nurses in General Practice, APNA online module
Increase knowledge of local population health needs
Collaborate with your PHN
Increase knowledge of local population health needs

1.answerText: I lead by coordinating and managing interdisciplinary collaboration to improve the individual's health outcomes.
1.name: Teamwork
1.definition: Works as part of a primary health care team, utilising the knowledge and skills to deliver person-centred nursing care

1.answerText: I'm confidently using my skills to identify, implement and evaluate the use of new technologies in health care delivery.
1.name: Tech Literacy
1.definition: Utilises information technology, clinical software and decision support tools to underpin health care delivery

1.answerText: I lead the development of quality improvement strategies to ensure they reflect a values-based approach to care.
1.name: Values-based Care
1.definition: Promote and influence others to incorporate non-judgmental, values-based care into clinical practice

2.answerText: I'm learning to work with the community to identify their healthcare needs.
2.name: Community education
2.definition: Addresses community health and support needs through collaboration with the community and the provision of information appropriate to the needs of the community

2.answerText: I confidently develop a positive learning environment for students and members of the primary health care team, giving and receiving feedback in an open, honest and constructive manner
2.name: Learning environment
2.definition: Facilitates and actively engages in cultivating an environment that improves learning

2.answerText: I lead and guide members of the primary health care team by providing relevant formal education.
2.name: Learning, teaching and assessment
2.definition: Incorporates learning, teaching and assessment into nursing role

2.answerText: I act as a leader by continually undertaking appropriate education and skill development to expand and maintain an advanced scope of practice.
2.name: Scope of Practice
2.definition: Optimises scope of practice through tailored education to ensure competence and confidence in area of practice

actionsToGrow.text: Consider joining your local APNA Nurse Network
Consider post graduate qualifications
Online Learning Module
Consider the introduction of a model of care, based on best practice

3.answerText: I lead by ensuring that evidence is integrated into the delivery of primary health care
3.name: Evidence-based practice
3.definition: Use evidence to underpin all nursing practice

actionsToGrow.text: Consider post graduate qualifications
The development of ORACLe
Contact national bodies to obtain current evidence-based clinical guidelines

3.answerText: I lead by identifying gaps in evidence and seek resources for evaluation or research activities.
3.name: Finding resources and support
3.definition: Identify opportunities and/or funding for quality improvement, research and evaluation

actionsToGrow.text: Consider joining your local APNA Nurse Network
Consider post graduate qualifications
Watch PHCRIS video guides
Explore Research Profiles

3.answerText: I lead quality improvement activities within the primary health care team
3.name: Quality Improvement
3.definition: Supports a culture of continuous quality improvement in all aspects of service delivery to achieve enhanced health outcomes

actionsToGrow.text: Develop partnerships
Become familiar with quality improvement frameworks
Access training programs
Participate in nurse networks

3.answerText: I lead by ensuring frameworks for research governance are applied appropriately.
3.name: Research and evaluation

actionsToGrow.text: Consider post graduate qualifications
Guides for understanding research
PHCRIS video guides
Explore Research Profiles

4.answerText: I'm confident in contributing to the ongoing development of local care pathways and encourage others to do so.
4.name: Care coordination
4.definition: Develops, supports and implements models of care coordination which improve care delivery

actionsToGrow.text: Consider post graduate qualifications
The development of ORACLe
Contact national bodies to obtain current evidence-based clinical guidelines

4.answerText: I lead by using change management theories to create an environment for positive change.
4.name: Drive change
4.definition: Act as a driver for change in clinical practice and systems

4.answerText: I lead by providing constructive feedback to my primary health care colleagues on their communication styles.
4.name: Effective communication
4.definition: Engages in and facilitates effective communication to optimise the functioning of interdisciplinary primary health care teams

4.answerText: I lead by developing and implementing innovative approaches to effective teamwork.
4.name: Effective teamwork
4.definition: Supports a culture of effective teamwork

4.answerText: I lead the development of guidelines, policies and procedures to deliver quality care.
4.name: Policies and procedures
4.definition: Develops, implements or reviews policies and procedures

5.answerText: I'm learning to identify an area of professional interest and provide relevant insights.
5.name: Being a resource
5.definition: Acts as a resource for professional organisations, the community, committees and other health professionals outside own setting

5.answerText: I lead and guide the establishment of professional networks that promote the exchange of knowledge, skills and resources.
5.name: Leadership
5.definition: Engages in professional and organisational leadership within and beyond own setting

actionsToGrow.text: Consider post graduate qualifications
A leadership framework for nurses that incorporates the five elements of leadership in a caring environment
Primary Health Care Research and information service (PHCRIS), fact sheets
Seek opportunities within your organization to participate in projects focused on clinical leadership

5.answerText: I'm confident to share information relevant to Student Nurses, Enrolled Nurses and Registered Nurses through existing networks.
5.name: Professional relationships
5.definition: Actively builds and maintains professional relationships with other nurses to contribute to the development of the profession

5.answerText: I'm confident to engage and recruit others to advocate for the role of the primary health care nurse.
5.name: Promote nursing
5.definition: Actively promotes the role of the nurse in primary health care

5.answerText: I lead through the presentation of research findings in peer reviewed journals and conferences.
5.name: Share knowledge
5.definition: Disseminates nursing knowledge to health professionals beyond own setting
